text: How to define a function is_member() that takes a value (i.e.
a number, string, etc) x and a list of values a, and returns True if x is a member of a, False otherwise.
(Note that this is exactly what the in operator does, but for the sake of the exercise I should pretend Python did not have this operator.
This is what I've come up with, but it doesn't work!

code:
def is_member(x, a):
   return x == a[::]
